numlitem.para: Bleed valve otherwise functions normally, and
Start valves on remaining engines are operative.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: A manual override ground start is required.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb. of applied torque to open.

numlitem.para: If PRSOV is to be opened with wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized:
Select the appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch OFF.
If the other engine on the same wing is running, select its ENGINE BLEED switch OFF.
When ready for engine start, advise ground crew to open the PRSOV.
Ensure the pneumatic manifold is pressurized and pull the appropriate engine start switch.

note.para: If PRSOV is opened with the wing pneumatic manifold unpressurized, select appropriate L or R ISLN VALVE switch ON after PRSOV is confirmed open by ground crew.

numlitem.para: At 45-50% N2, request closed PRSOV to ground crew.
Ensure ENGINE BLEED switch for other engine on same wing is selected ON.
Starter assisted inflight start is not available for the affected engine.

placard.para: Placard adjacent to associated START switch on the Engine Ignition and Start Control panel (P5): "ENG_STARTER INOP INFLIGHT". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: The PRSOV is installed in the strut. Access to the PRSOV manual override drive is on the left side of the strut. It is not necessary to open any access panels to operate the PRSOV manual override drive. The PRSOV is spring loaded to the closed position. It can be manually held in the open position for engine starting. After engine start, the inoperative PRSOV must be manually placed in the locked closed position.

para.emphasis: Special Tools and Equipment: G71021– 6 – Drive Extension – Starter Valve and PRSOV.

warning.para: DO NOT OPERATE THE THRUST REVERSER DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV. THRUST REVERSER OPERATION DURING MANUAL OPERATION OF THE PRSOV CAN CAUSE SERIOUS PERSONNEL INJURY AND DAMAGE.
DO NOT USE ENGINE NACELLE SERVICE INTERPHONE JACK ON ENGINE WHICH IS TO BE STARTED OR ON ENGINE IN OPERATION. PERSONNEL COULD ENTER HAZARD AREA RESULTING IN SERIOUS INJURY OR LOSS OF LIFE.

numlitem.para: Establish interphone communication with the flight deck and determine if the applicable wing manifold will be pressurized or unpressurized for associated engine start.

note.para: The amount of torque necessary to open the PRSOV depends on existing pneumatic pressure. If manifold is unpressurized, the PRSOV will open easily. If manifold is pressurized, the PRSOV may require up to 50 ft-lb of applied torque to open.

para.emphasis: DO NOT ROTATE THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE QUICKLY WHEN THERE IS NO WING MANIFOLD PNEUMATIC PRESSURE. FAST OPERATION OF THE MANUAL OVERRIDE DRIVE MAY RESULT IN TEMPORARY JAMMING OF THE ACTUATOR OR POSSIBLE DIAPHRAGM DAMAGE..

numlitem.para: When requested by the flight crew, slowly turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90° clockwise to the open position. Hold it in the open position until the flight crew requests a closed PRSOV.
When flight crew requests closed PRSOV, turn the PRSOV manual override drive 90° counterclockwise to the closed position.

note.para: Do not lock the PRSOV in the CLOSED position.
